metadata.synopsis: Gino Monetti (Edward G. Robinson) has made his fortune banking, but he hasn't done it legally. When the authorities come after him, three of his sons turn their backs on him, angry over how he treated them in the past. Max (Richard Conte), his fourth son, stands by his father during his trial and stays loyal to him even when he is sent to prison. Max plots revenge against his brothers for betraying their father, while his brothers plot their own revenge against him.

reviews: Strangers is not a true reflection of Italian Americans. It insults Italians in much the same way that [Lost Boundaries] insults the Negro people.
A hardboiled tale of warfare within an Italian banking family, it is absorbing and powerful.
...clearly influential (star Conte even went on to play "The Godfather's" Don Barzini)...
Superb performances by Conte, Robinson, and Adler lift the ordinary dramatics into loftier territory.
Inspirado no mesmo livro que deu origem a A Lana Partida, o filme foi adaptado pelo mesmo Philip Yordan, mas tambm no funciona.
